reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were extremely impressed with the overall quality of the Santa Lucia. It was one of the smartest and cleanest hotels we have stayed in in France, even down to the modern double glazing, airconditioning, spotless bathroom, hot tub facility in the patio area (!) and flatscreen TV. The staff were always helpful, attentive and smiling. There was a good variety of fresh fruit salad, cold meats, egg, cheese, etc., besides the usual fare in the French buffet breakfast (nice to have it included in the deal). We could leave our hire car in the hotel car park behind the security gates, again with no extra payment.
reviews.title: As good as we hoped it would be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As stated in previous reviews, tihs is a lovely small hotel. The staff are pleasant and helpful. It is close to the harbour and we enjoyed out stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is actually about half an hours walk out of Saint Raphael along the promenade, through the pretty Santa L Lucia Marina and along a road so no good if you don’t want to drive and aren’t keen on walking. However the Marina has a good choice of bars and restaurants and is only ten minutes away on foot. It is a lovely small hotel with very friendly staff. It is immaculate inside and out. There is a small courtyard and a separate area with a Jacuzzi and sun loungers. It is very private and extra towels are provided for free. The rooms are individually decorated with themes from different countries but they are quite small and the bathrooms are also compact. There are hairdryers a safe and a kettle (ask at reception for milk). The breakfasts are good with choices of cereal meats cheeses and fruit as well as a delicious choice of pastries. There is free internet access in reception. They will serve you a drink at any time of day to drink outside or in the small lounge. Overall this is a great value hotel for the area.
reviews.title: Out of town but worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel based on the feedback provided on TripAdvisor and we certainly weren't disappointed! We only stayed the one night but we were very impressed with the staff and the facilities - and especially the hot tub at the back of the hotel, nice and relaxing after a long day in the car! And the free internet access in the lobby was an added bonus!
reviews.title: A little gem - welcoming and charming!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the African room, whilst it was on the small side we couldn't fault the cleanliness and modern decor, the bed was amazingly comfortable, the air conditioning was quiet, the bathroom was spacious and clean, extra towels were provided for the hot-tub. I just loved the whole feel of this hotel, welcoming and charming!
reviews.title: after viewing one or two in the area to find this classy and charming hotel was a real bonus !

reviews.text: The hotel website states that there is onsite parking - we discovered that there is secure, gated parking for only 6 cars but there is an area across the road from the hotel that you can park for free. It's on the main road and our car was perfectly safe there for the night. I would say that if you don't have a car the hotel may be a little bit far from St Raphael town itself but we were able to walk to the nearby marina which has loads of restaurants to choose from and you can oogle the luxurious yachts and cruisers that are docked there!
reviews.title: a quaint little gem in a beautiful beach setting
